str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To come together. From sun and eimi; to assemble.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To travel, journey (to). From epi and poreuomai; to journey further, i.e. Travel on.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
From paraballo; a similitude, i.e. fictitious narrative, apothegm or adage.
